thread.title: Telegraph Junior Golf 2015:

author: Rod Gilmour
title: Telegraph Junior Golf 2015:
text: • Latest Telegraph Junior Ch'ship news • Read how 2014 Telegraph winners fared at BMW Pro-Am • Read profiles on the 2015 girls' finalists BOYS' FINALISTS Who will follow in the footsteps of previous winners Justin Rose, Matthew Fitzpatrick, Hayley Davis and Carly Booth? The 30th anniversary of the longstanding Telegraph BMW Junior Championships is looming for the 21 junior finalists and the qualifying leaderboards revealed a wide open field for the 12 boys and nine girls who will play on the North Course at Quinta do Lago in the Algarve. Here, we run the rule over the competitors, including another 14-year-old finalist and two returning juniors. Jamie Li The Bath junior returns to the Telegraph finals for a third successive year. Li has twice threatened the leaderboard previously and the former Millfield student will be a title contender this time with added course nous. Fell at final round of qualifying for this year's Open Championship, but topped Telegraph qualifying with a blistering -7 round. Barclay Brown His Sheffield Open Amateur win in July saw the 14-year-old become the event's youngest ever winner, beating European tour pro Danny Willett's success as a 16-year-old in 2004. Brown will become the second youngest ever to compete in Portugal after Hugo Kedzlie last year. • A recap on how the 2014 junior titles were won John Gough Having lost Stoke Park's Junior Championship in July, he then became the youngest ever county champion by five shots last month. The Bucks teenager qualified thanks to a super -6 round. Joseph Bryce After a classy opening 66, the Edinburgh junior finished with silver at the prestigious Henry Cooper Junior Masters at Nizels, his -6 gross score securing a berth for our event at Quinta do Lago. • See the illustrious winners on our roll of honours' boards Mark Flynn As Formby Hall captain, he follows the likes of fellow member Tommy Fleetwood to make the finals, having won Royal Birkdale's Junior Open, which included his -5 qualifying round. Callum Farr The Priors Hall (Northants) member shook up his home club with an -8 course record this summer. The 17-year-old also won the Midlands Boys’ title and tied for ninth in the British Boys' stroke play. Kieran Faulkner Looe's 17-year-old three handicapper qualified by virtue of a -4 gross score at Launceston Golf Club. Member of the Truro and Penwith College Golf Academy first team. Thomas Plumb Consistent form has seen the Sherborne 16-year-old play for the regional England squad for a year. Took up golf aged three and represents Dorset's under-18 team. Sean Dimmick The 16-year-old is a multiple winner on the Dorset junior circuit last year and has taken that form into 2015 with four under par scores in competition as he squeezed into the Telegraph finals. Daniel List The one handicapper rates his fourth place in the English Amateur strokeplay as his season high. Hails from Perth, Australia and currently studying at Wellington College. Joao Girão Quinta do Lago's sponsors' invite is considered a bright talent in Portugese junior golf. Aiming to follow Vitor Lopes' superb win last year, the Oporto junior recently finished fifth at the Belgian Boys. Billy Spooner The UK boys' invite from Woodhall Spa, home of England Golf, represented his country in the Sir Henry Cooper Junior Masters, finishing with a top 10 finish at the British Boys. Follow the latest news, leaderboards , images and build-up to October’s Finals on Twitter @TelegraphJunior and on our Facebook page
